title: Prepare to Be Shocked: This Expensive-Looking (and Once-Dated) Sneaker Trend Is Secretly So Affordable
excerpt: Everyone will think these sneakers are designer.
text: Sneakers have become one of those wardrobe essentials that just make sense. Gone are the days when they were solely reserved for gym sessions or weekend errands—now, they're just as likely to be spotted under a tailored suit as they are with a relaxed tracksuit. I've lost count of how many times I've reached for a pair over heels, not just for practicality (though that helps), but because they genuinely complete an outfit in a way that feels modern and effortless. And the best part? You don't have to spend a fortune to find a great pair. Right now, retro, 70s-inspired sneakers are trending hard, and we found the best affordable pairs to prove that style, comfort, and being on-trend don't always have to come with a luxury price tag.Of course, the fashion world's love affair with sneakers isn't exactly new. What started as a purely functional shoe has evolved into a cultural icon, shaped by everything from sportswear trends to subcultures and street style movements. Fast-forward to 2025, and sneakers are more relevant than ever, thanks to their runway credentials. Loewe's Flow Runners and On Cloudventure collaborations have quickly become fashion-editor favourites, while Miu Miu's distressed ballet-style sneakers continue to dominate street style. Even The Row, known for its ultra-minimal aesthetic, has embraced the trend with its effortlessly cool Marie H trainers, proving that sleek, understated sneakers are just as covetable as their chunkier counterparts.The spring and summer 2025 collections cemented their status, with designers like Miu Miu pairing retro-inspired styles with sheer skirts and tailored blazers, while Loewe went all in on futuristic, sculptural silhouettes. But beyond the catwalk, trainers have infiltrated every corner of fashion, with even the most dedicated heel lovers (myself included) fully converted.That's not to say that navigating the world of trainers is easy. With endless styles, collaborations, and cult-favourite brands vying for attention, finding the right pair can feel overwhelming. Yes, Adidas Sambas are still having a moment, and New Balance's retro runners continue to dominate the fashion crowd, but there's a fresh trend in the mix that won't cost you an absurd amount to buy into. Over the past few years, brands like COS, Mango, and Zara have seriously upped their game, creating styles that feel just as elevated as designer options but at a fraction of the price, and right now, they are nailing the retro sneaker trend. I'm all about the high-low mix—investing in timeless staples while hunting down affordable finds that look far more expensive than they are—and sneakers are one of the easiest ways to master this balance, particularly as it pertains to this trend.Some of my most-worn sneakers aren't from big-name brands at all. I still get compliments on an unbranded pair I picked up from COS last year—sleek, minimal, and ridiculously comfortable, they've been my go-to for everything from coffee runs to long days on my feet running to and from meetings. Over the years, we've seen some incredible partnerships, from H&M's designer drops to Mango's sleek sportswear-inspired collections. These retailers offer the perfect mix of exclusivity and affordability, proving that you don't need to splurge to get a great pair of sneakers.To save you the scroll, I've rounded up the best affordable sneakers available right now, covering five standout brands that are leading the way in 2025.Shop The Best Affordable Sneakers: 1. ZaraZara is known for its high-fashion approach with affordable price-points, and its sneaker collection follows suit. Whether they're taking inspiration from designer styles or reinventing classic silhouettes with a modern twist, Zara's footwear selection is always ahead of the curve.Shop Zara Sneakers: Zara Padded Running Shoes This pop of color is perfect. Zara Soft Athletic Sneakers The ultimate everyday trainer—polished, comfortable, and endlessly wearable. Zara Metallic Effect Sneakers A subtle hint of shimmer that makes everyday outfits feel a little more polished. 2. Massimo DuttiMassimo Dutti might not be the first brand that comes to mind for sneakers, but trust me—it should be. The quality-to-price ratio is unbeatable, and the designs have a classic, versatile feel. Whether you need an everyday go-to or a pair for long walks, their offering is seriously impressive.Shop Massimo Dutti Sneakers: Massimo Dutti White Topstitched Trainers One of my personal favorites. They work with everything. Massimo Dutti Metallic Trainers Perfect for adding a little glitz to an otherwise simple look. Massimo Dutti Velvet Trainers The definition of luxury. 3. J.CrewJ.Crew consistently delivers on trend-led, affordable fashion, and the sneakers are no exception. Whether you're after sporty, street-style-inspired sneakers or something more classic, the brand's selection covers all bases. The quality has seriously improved over the years, making them a great budget-friendly choice.Shop J.Crew Sneakers: J.Crew Rec Sneakers in Suede These come highly recommended from team WWW. J.Crew Rec Sneakers in Crinkle Metallic Leather Metallic sneakers are clearly having a moment this spring. J.Crew Rec Sneakers in Leather This pair truly looks designer. 4. MangoMango has always been a go-to for polished, trend-forward pieces, and the brand's sneaker collection is no exception. Expect sleek silhouettes, chocolate suedes, and elevated details that make each pair feel far more premium than their price tag suggests. If you're after sneakers that feel versatile yet fashion-conscious, Mango is an excellent choice.Shop Mango Sneakers: Mango Suede-Blend Sneakers With Laces Chocolate and suede—these could not be more 2025 even if they tried. Mango Suede-Blend Sneakers With Laces These will go with everything. Mango Satin Lace-Up Sneakers Perfect for those who love a clean, understated aesthetic. 5. COSFor those who love clean lines, premium fabrics, and a minimal aesthetic, COS is a no-brainer. The brand's footwear collection reflects its signature approach to fashion—pared-back, well-constructed, and timeless. COS sneakers are ideal if you want something that looks effortlessly expensive without the designer price tag.Shop COS Sneakers: COS Minimal Suede Sneakers A modern take on a retro style. Lightweight and breathable, the red version is perfect for warm weather. COS Minimal Leather Trainers A sleek, no-fuss design that works with everything from tailored trousers to relaxed denim. COS Minimal Leather Trainers The subtle contrast of suede and leather gives these a refined edge. And the black is a great alternative to classic white sneakers. This post originally appeared on Who What Wear UK.
html:
Sneakers have become one of those wardrobe essentials that just make sense. Gone are the days when they were solely reserved for gym sessions or weekend errands—now, they're just as likely to be spotted under a tailored suit as they are with a relaxed tracksuit. I've lost count of how many times I've reached for a pair over heels, not just for practicality (though that helps), but because they genuinely complete an outfit in a way that feels modern and effortless. And the best part? You don't have to spend a fortune to find a great pair. Right now, retro, 70s-inspired sneakers are trending hard, and we found the best affordable pairs to prove that style, comfort, and being on-trend don't always have to come with a luxury price tag.

Of course, the fashion world's love affair with sneakers isn't exactly new. What started as a purely functional shoe has evolved into a cultural icon, shaped by everything from sportswear trends to subcultures and street style movements. Fast-forward to 2025, and sneakers are more relevant than ever, thanks to their runway credentials. Loewe's Flow Runners and On Cloudventure collaborations have quickly become fashion-editor favourites, while Miu Miu's distressed ballet-style sneakers continue to dominate street style. Even The Row, known for its ultra-minimal aesthetic, has embraced the trend with its effortlessly cool Marie H trainers, proving that sleek, understated sneakers are just as covetable as their chunkier counterparts.

The spring and summer 2025 collections cemented their status, with designers like Miu Miu pairing retro-inspired styles with sheer skirts and tailored blazers, while Loewe went all in on futuristic, sculptural silhouettes. But beyond the catwalk, trainers have infiltrated every corner of fashion, with even the most dedicated heel lovers (myself included) fully converted.

That's not to say that navigating the world of trainers is easy. With endless styles, collaborations, and cult-favourite brands vying for attention, finding the right pair can feel overwhelming. Yes, Adidas Sambas are still having a moment, and New Balance's retro runners continue to dominate the fashion crowd, but there's a fresh trend in the mix that won't cost you an absurd amount to buy into. Over the past few years, brands like COS, Mango, and Zara have seriously upped their game, creating styles that feel just as elevated as designer options but at a fraction of the price, and right now, they are nailing the retro sneaker trend. I'm all about the high-low mix—investing in timeless staples while hunting down affordable finds that look far more expensive than they are—and sneakers are one of the easiest ways to master this balance, particularly as it pertains to this trend.

Some of my most-worn sneakers aren't from big-name brands at all. I still get compliments on an unbranded pair I picked up from COS last year—sleek, minimal, and ridiculously comfortable, they've been my go-to for everything from coffee runs to long days on my feet running to and from meetings. Over the years, we've seen some incredible partnerships, from H&M's designer drops to Mango's sleek sportswear-inspired collections. These retailers offer the perfect mix of exclusivity and affordability, proving that you don't need to splurge to get a great pair of sneakers.

To save you the scroll, I've rounded up the best affordable sneakers available right now, covering five standout brands that are leading the way in 2025.

Shop The Best Affordable Sneakers:

1. Zara

Zara is known for its high-fashion approach with affordable price-points, and its sneaker collection follows suit. Whether they're taking inspiration from designer styles or reinventing classic silhouettes with a modern twist, Zara's footwear selection is always ahead of the curve.

Shop Zara Sneakers:

Zara

Padded Running Shoes

This pop of color is perfect.

Zara

Soft Athletic Sneakers

The ultimate everyday trainer—polished, comfortable, and endlessly wearable.

Zara

Metallic Effect Sneakers

A subtle hint of shimmer that makes everyday outfits feel a little more polished.

2. Massimo Dutti

Massimo Dutti might not be the first brand that comes to mind for sneakers, but trust me—it should be. The quality-to-price ratio is unbeatable, and the designs have a classic, versatile feel. Whether you need an everyday go-to or a pair for long walks, their offering is seriously impressive.

Shop Massimo Dutti Sneakers:

Massimo Dutti

White Topstitched Trainers

One of my personal favorites. They work with everything.

Massimo Dutti

Metallic Trainers

Perfect for adding a little glitz to an otherwise simple look.

Massimo Dutti

Velvet Trainers

The definition of luxury.

3. J.Crew

J.Crew consistently delivers on trend-led, affordable fashion, and the sneakers are no exception. Whether you're after sporty, street-style-inspired sneakers or something more classic, the brand's selection covers all bases. The quality has seriously improved over the years, making them a great budget-friendly choice.

Shop J.Crew Sneakers:

J.Crew

Rec Sneakers in Suede

These come highly recommended from team WWW.

J.Crew

Rec Sneakers in Crinkle Metallic Leather

Metallic sneakers are clearly having a moment this spring.

J.Crew

Rec Sneakers in Leather

This pair truly looks designer.

4. Mango

Mango has always been a go-to for polished, trend-forward pieces, and the brand's sneaker collection is no exception. Expect sleek silhouettes, chocolate suedes, and elevated details that make each pair feel far more premium than their price tag suggests. If you're after sneakers that feel versatile yet fashion-conscious, Mango is an excellent choice.

Shop Mango Sneakers:

Mango

Suede-Blend Sneakers With Laces

Chocolate and suede—these could not be more 2025 even if they tried.

Mango

Suede-Blend Sneakers With Laces

These will go with everything.

Mango

Satin Lace-Up Sneakers

Perfect for those who love a clean, understated aesthetic.

5. COS

For those who love clean lines, premium fabrics, and a minimal aesthetic, COS is a no-brainer. The brand's footwear collection reflects its signature approach to fashion—pared-back, well-constructed, and timeless. COS sneakers are ideal if you want something that looks effortlessly expensive without the designer price tag.

Shop COS Sneakers:

COS

Minimal Suede Sneakers

A modern take on a retro style. Lightweight and breathable, the red version is perfect for warm weather.

COS

Minimal Leather Trainers

A sleek, no-fuss design that works with everything from tailored trousers to relaxed denim.

COS

Minimal Leather Trainers

The subtle contrast of suede and leather gives these a refined edge. And the black is a great alternative to classic white sneakers.

This post originally appeared on Who What Wear UK.
